answerText: closed[10] This theorem shows that given equicontinuity of a sequence of functions defined on a compact space, that sequence will have a uniformly convergent subsequence. It is similar to the Bolzano Weierstrass theorem, but for functions.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 8 | 20 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: A Euclidean space is compact if it has this property and is bounded by the Heine-Borel theorem. For 10 points each: [10] Name this property where all the limit points of a space are located within the space. It is exemplified by its namesake type of interval that contains its ending points and it is generally the opposite property of being open.
